content: ARM's real-time profile core family â€” deterministic, low-latency execution for safety-critical systems. Found in automotive ECUs (braking, airbags), hard-drive controllers, and baseband modems. Features tightly-coupled memory, dual-core lockstep (fault detection), and fast interrupt response. Runs bare-metal or RTOS, not Linux. Bridges the gap between cortex-M and cortex-A. core cortex-M cortex-A
